text: Belforest is a small, unincorporated community in Baldwin County, Alabama, United States. Belforest is located on Alabama State Route 181, east of Daphne. ==History== St. Adorka’s African Universal Church in Belforest. The community name likely comes from a combination of the French word bel, meaning "beautiful," and forest. A post office operated under the name Belforest from 1900 to 1911. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Baldwin County, Alabama Category:Unincorporated communities in Alabama Category:Populated coastal places in Alabama
title: Belforest, Alabama
